p: Agaricus bisporus Imbach (white button mushroom), with the first reports on the cultivation date from 1707, from France, produces about 32% of total edible mushroom in the world, extensively recognized for its nutritional, medicinal, and organoleptic attributes (Gao, Feng, & Jiang, 2014; Khan et al., 2014; Rzymski, Mleczek, Niedzielski, Siwulskid, & Asecka, 2017). A.Â bisporus is a perishable food product that its shelf life may be limited by bacterial spoilage or enzymatic browning, depending on handling and storage conditions (Sapers, Miller, Pilizota, & Kamp, 2001).
